content.title: Indira Mahila Shakti Prashikshan Evam Koshal Sanvardhan Yojana (RS-CSEP)
content.details: The Rajasthan government's Women and Child Development Department offers a program called Indira Mahila Shakti Prashikshan Evam Koshal Sanvardhan Yojana (RS-CSEP). This free program helps women and girls improve their spoken English and communication skills, along with building their confidence. By learning new skills or sharpening existing ones, participants gain the tools they need to find better jobs, start their own businesses, and achieve financial independence. The program goes beyond just skills training, aiming to empower women by providing support and knowledge in areas like entrepreneurship, leadership, managing money, and personal growth. Training period: 130 hours (2 hours a day, 5 days a week).
benefits: Free spoken English and personality development training is given to women and girls.
eligibility: The applicant is a native citizen of Rajasthan.
The applicant's age should be 16 to 45 years old.
The applicant should have passed class 12th.
Widow/divorced/abandoned women suffering from violence be given priority.
content.application_process: Online. Applicants have to visit the official portal, enter their mobile number, and follow the steps to apply.
documents_required: Copy of the FIR in the case of a woman victim of violence / Domestic Incident Report under the Protection / Copy of the document for registering the case at Women's Safety and Advice Center / Aparajita.
Caste certificate in case of Scheduled Castes and Tribes.
Death certificate of husband in case of widow/talaq deed in case of divorcee/affidavit of desertion in case of deserter.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to provide free spoken English and personality development training to women and girls.

faqs.question: What will be the age criteria?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be 16 to 45 years old.

faqs.question: May Other State persons also apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only Rajasthan citizens can apply for this scheme.

faqs.question: What is the meaning of RKCL?
Can students from all streams avail the benefits of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, all streams can avail the benefits of this scheme.

faqs.question: Under which department does this scheme come?
How do I know if a field in the application form is mandatory?
Is this scheme only for women?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is only for women.

faqs.question: Is this scheme for Urban area?
faqs.answer: Yes, Urban and Rural both people can apply for this scheme.
